info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 3:08PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Mississippi and southeastern Scott Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 308 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bertrand, or 8 miles northwest of Charleston, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Mississippi and southeastern Scott Counties, including the following locations... Diehlstadt and Blodgett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
